gemstone.name: Emerlad
gemstone.description: Emeralds are the most popular jewelry stones and most desirable for their durability, luster,    rarity and beauty. It is a gemstone-colored green by trace amount of chromium. The oldest    emerald dates to about 2500 million years. The first known emeralds were mined in Egypt    around 1500 B.C. They have a vibrant green color which has many values throughout time.    Emeralds are the member of beryl family and one of the big four precious gemstones along    ruby, diamond and sapphire. They are known for caring the rich green color and radiates a    beautiful vivid tone. In ancient Greece and Rome, emerald was said to be the gemstone of    the goddess Venus, purveyor of love and hope. On the other side of the world, emeralds    were revered by the Incas and believed by the Egyptians to be a source of eternal life.    They are considered to be a symbol of rebirth and love. Emeralds are known as may birth stone.

type.name: Treated rubies
type.description: Gemstone have been treated to improve their appearance for a very long time. Treatment isused to improve the clarity and color of a gemstone. Treated emeralds are natural emeraldspass through treatment. emeralds have been treated for many years to overcome the inherentsoftness of the emeralds and give them an improvement in their appearance. The mostcommon emerald treatment are oiling and fracture filling.Fracture filling with oil- The traditional treatment for emerald is fracture-filling with naturaloils. Emeralds have surface reaching fractures that are treated with oil. Cedarwood oil is mostcommonly used, because it is colorless and has a refractive index close to emerald.Opticon filler- opticon filler is the other way of emerald treatment. It has more stability thanoiling. It fills flaws and improve the color and appearance of the emerd.

type.name: Untreated emeralds
type.description: Untreated emeralds are natural emeralds as mined from the earth. They are the kind of   emeralds that has not been treated at all which means no oiling or fracture filling. Less than 2%of emeralds make it to market completely untreated. There fore, they are the rarest and themost valuable emeralds.

type.name: Synthetic emeralds
type.description: Synthetic emeralds are growing in laboratories, man made rubies. They are identical with thenatural rubies with their chemical and crystal compositions. They only differ with place of. And they are different to synthesize. They are less expensive than the real naturalemeralds.

type.name: Hardness
type.description: Hardness for gemstones is the ability to resist scratching. It is about the bonds between the   atoms in the stone. Emeralds are very resistant to scratches. They are relatively hard 7.5 to 8   on Mohs scale of hardness from the scale of 1 to 10, 10 being the hardest. Mohs scale is the   direct measurement of hardness of gems.

type.name: Durability
type.description: Emeralds are very durable gems. They have a great hardness which means it is pretty durable can be worn everyday. They have great toughness and no cleavage. Their hardness indicates their high durability.

quality.name: Color
quality.description: Color is the most meaningful ‘C’, since emeralds are most of all about color. The Chromium and vanadium in emeralds make an intense green color bring out its beauty. The most desired colors are bluish green to pure green. The most valuable emeralds are highly transparent. Hue in emerald color- hue refers to the color as we see it. It is about the type of the green color it has. It shouldn’t be too yellowish or too bluish. The most valuable emeralds have the    intensity of green in its finest.    Saturation in emerald color- saturation determines the visibility of the color. It is about the    depth or the intensity of the color. The most desirable emeralds are filled with vivid color of    saturation which is not dull. Saturation gives the color its intensity and gives the emerald    sparkling light green color with vivid saturation.    Tone in emerald color- the other to be considered aspect to the color of emeralds is the    tone. Tone refers to the purity of the color. It describes how light and how dark the emerald is.It is whether it is light or dark. The color must not be neither too dark or too light to beconsidered good quality.

quality.name: Clarity
quality.description: Clarity in gemstone refers to what the stone should not have. The highest clarity means free of  inclusion. However, emeralds contain inclusion that is easily visible. They are major gemstone   expected to have visible inclusion. They are known for being included. The higher the clarity the  more valuable the emerald is. Eye clean are more valuable and the inclusion should not have anegative impact on the transparency to be considered valuable.

quality.name: Cut
quality.description: The third ‘C’ is cut, the other most important factor for the quality of emerald gemstone. The  purpose for gemstone cut is to enhance their beauty. Cut in emeralds refers to its shape,  faceting and depth. When making the cut, the color and inclusion must be considered. The  cutter must minimize the affect of the fractures. It should be symmetrical with the facets. Theround and oval cuts are most expensive type of emeralds.

quality.name: Carat
quality.description: Carat refers to weight of gemstones. Carat is the way gemstone weight is measured. Carat is one of the 4C’s in how quality is assessed because it is the most important for the reason man          people think ‘bigger is better’. Like most other gems, emeralds are also weighed in carat. Emeralds come in a wide range of size. The price increases as the size increases.

gemstone.name: Opal
gemstone.description: Opals are the most popular gemstones. They are beautiful gems that come in rainbow of hues.  Opals have the color of other gems. Most opal are more than the age of 60 million years.  Sources agree that opals are discovered in Australia, in the late 1880s. Australia produces the  95% of opal in the gemstone market. However, opals mostly found in Australia, they are also found in Brazil, Ethiopia, western USA and other places. Opals has the color of other gems.     Romans believe it is the most precious and powerful gemstone for its different and many   colors. Arabians believe opal fell from the sky and contains lightning. They grow by filling   cavities in the earth and sometimes they take the shapes of the thing buried in the ground.   Opals are used to cure eye related problems and can promote vision and insight. They can also   act as emotional stabilizer. Opals are believed to bring peace, loyalty, fortune, joy and   faithfulness to the wearer. It is October birth stone and believed to bring good luck for thepeople born in the month.

type.name: Treated rubies
type.description: Gemstone have been treated to improve their appearance for a very long time. Treatment is used to improve the clarity and color of a gemstone. Treated opals are natural opals pass through treatment. Opals have been treated for many years to overcome the inherent softness of the opal and give them an improvement in their appearance. There are some ways of     treating opals.Acid and sugar- this is the most common opal treatment method. It is the process of cooking the opal in a sugar solution. It helps the opal get more beautiful. The reaction of the acid and sugar places carbon as black spot and make it more beautiful. Heat treatment- for permanent treating solution, opals are treated by heat treatment. In the end result the treatment will help the stone become more vibrant. Heat treatment and oil treatment help opals color to be brighter.Fracture filling- the other opal treatment method is fracture filling. Opals that have fracture will be filled with an “opticon”. It used to improve the visibility and clarity of the ruby. It is atreatment for durability

type.name: Untreated opals
type.description: Untreated opals are natural rubies as mined from the earth. They are the kind of opals that hasnot been treated at all. It is composed by water so it cant be heat or irradiated.

type.name: Synthetic opals
type.description: Synthetic opals are growing in laboratories, lab created, man-made opals. They are identical   with the natural rubies with their chemical and crystal compositions and looks so much like the natural opals. They only differ with place of origin. They have lower expensive than the real   natural opals and appreciated by many people.

type.name: Hardness
type.description: Hardness for gemstones is the ability to resist scratching. It is about the bonds between the atoms in the stone. Hardness of opal gemstone vary depending on its composition and formation but range between 5 to 6 in Mohs scale. Which is the measurement of gems       hardness. Their hardness is poor compared to some other gemstones. They have the same hardness as glass. They require special care not to scratch and avoid damage.

type.name: Durability
type.description: In case of durability, opals aren’t that good. Since opal isn’t a harder gemstone, it is vulnerableand can get scratched and damaged if it couldn’t get the proper care.

quality.name: Color
quality.description: Color In opal plays a main role in determining the value of opals. Warmer colors are seen rarely rather than the most common hues, blue and green in opal. The warmer colors are visible in the  opal, the more it is expensive. Opals might display as ingle color or 2, or 3, or even the full color of a rainbow. Opals are divided in to different types by their color. Some of those are: Black opal- black opal is the most valued, most popular and the rarest type of opals. They come lightning ridge. The term black refers to the darker body tone compared to the other types of opals in the background. White opal- white opal is an opal with translucent to opaque white body color. It is a color tone ranging from colorless to medium gray. They are more common opals and the least valuable form of opals. These is due to the lack of darkness and the fact that they are more common. Fire opal- the body color of the fire opal has a warm yellow, orange or red color, translucent to transparent. They are mostly known as Mexican fire opals, because of the reason they are more found in Mexico. Fire opal are also found in Ethiopia where a more beautiful opals are discovered recently.Boulder opal- the boulder opal has the host rock forming, translucent to opaque. It can be black or light in color. It is opal formed in ironstone. They display the natural seems and patches as they occur within the host rock. Water opal- this opal stone is a bluish gray opal that displays a color or a jelly like appearance. It is the colourless variety of precious opal stone. It is a clear to translucentgemstone with small flashes of color.

quality.name: Clarity
quality.description: Clarity in gemstone refers to what the stone should not have. The highest clarity means free of inclusion. In case of opals, clarity is influenced by the degree transparency and the lack of inclusion. However, opals have some flaws that affect their clarity, such us, fracture, sand, sandstone and fragment of its host rock. The best clarity for opal is its transparency degree. The brighter the opal is the more valuable it is.

quality.name: Cut
quality.description: Opals are not typically faceted. Cut in opal considers some factors such us, the color, clarity and  pattern of the stone. The point is to cut to top quality cut to show off its beautiful play of color.  The most valuable opal in the gemstone market considering its cut is an opal cut which goes  with the color and pattern.

quality.name: Carat
quality.description: Carat refers to weight of gemstones. Carat is the way gemstone weight is measured. Like most other gems, opals also measured in carat. Opals occur in a different range of size. However, they have relatively lower density compared to the other gemstone. There for, they don’t feel heavy when wearing. Good quality opals are available in a wide range of size. The larger an opal the more expensive it is.

gemstone.description: Rubies are the most popular jewelry stones and most desirable for their hardness, durability, luster and rarity. Rubies are the most valuable gem-quality corundum. Rubies are discovered as early as 2500 B.C in Mogok of Myanmar. The word ruby comes from the Latin word “ruber which means red. Rubies are distinguished for their bright red color. They are always red with a vivid level of saturation, hue and tone. The saturation in rubies color determine the visibilitywhether it is darker or lighter, the hue refers the color as we see it and the tone determine whether there it has a pure tone or not. Different type of ruby color ranges starts from pink red to blood red. Blood red ruby is the brightest and most valuable one. Rubies get their color difference from the presence of chromium in it. The red color is why rubies have a distinct separation from sapphires. Rubies and sapphires have identical properties except for the color.Rubies are known as July birthstone.
gemstone.name: Ruby

type.name: Treated rubies
type.description: Gemstone have been treated to improve their appearance for a very long time. Treatment isused to improve the clarity and color of a gemstone. Treated rubies are natural rubies pass  through treatment. The three most common ruby treatment are heat treatment, fracture filling        and beryllium diffusion. Heat treatment- heat treatment is the most common ruby treating method. It means        heating ruby to the highest temperature of heat. The main idea is that heat will dissolve inclusions which improves the clarity and color. In this process the ruby will remain strong and durable as it was before. Fracture filling- the other most common treatment method that is used for rubies is fracturefilling. It is bleached and heated and fractured filled with colored glass. It used to improve thevisibility and clarity of the ruby.     Beryllium diffusion- beryllium diffusion is the least popular and preferable but yet, stable     and permanent method of treatment. It can be used to create a more intensive color.

type.name: Untreated rubies
type.description: Untreated rubies are natural rubies as mined from the earth. They are the kind of rubies that  has not been treated at all. Less than 1% of rubies make it to market. There fore, they are the  rarest and the most valuable rubies.

type.name: Synthetic rubies
type.description: Synthetic rubies are growing in laboratories rubies. They are made by melting aluminium oxide  which contains chromium. They are identical with the natural rubies with their chemical and  crystal compositions. They only differ with place of origin.  They are less expensive than the real natural rubies and take only months to form rather million  years

type.name: Hardness
type.description: Hardness for gemstones is the ability to resist scratching. It is about the bonds between the atoms in the stone. Rubies are relatively hard 9 on Mohs scale of hardness from the scale of 1 to 10, 10 being the hardest. Mohs scale is the measurement of gems hardness and it is the second hardest gem next to diamond.

type.name: Durability
type.description: In case of durability, rubies are the most durable gemstone. They have great toughness and nocleavage. Their hardness indicates their high durability.

quality.name: Color
quality.description: The most factor regarding the quality of rubies is the color. Aspects to be considered to thecolor of the rubies are hue, saturation and tone.Hue- hue refers to the color as we see it. Rubies have primary and secondary hues. Theprimary color(hue) is red and the secondary color range from pink, purple to orange. So, whenit comes to value, rubies with the primary color have the highest value.Saturation-saturation determines the visibility of the color. It is about the depth or theintensity of the color. Intensive saturated or rubies with ‘vivid’ saturation are considered to bethe most valuable ruby in the gemstone market.Tone- the other to be considered aspect to the color of rubies is the tone. Tone refers to thepurity of the color. It describes how light and how dark the ruby is. The pure red medium toneis considered to be the highest quality rubies. The color must not be neither too dark or toolight to be considered good quality

quality.name: Clarity
quality.description: Clarity in gemstone refers to what the stone should not have. The highest clarity means free ofinclusion. However, rubies are mostly host to many inclusions. Inclusion-free rubies are non existent. So, the value o ruby clarity depends on the visibility of the inclusion. The best clarity for ruby is “eye clean”, which is no visible inclusion with the naked eye.

quality.name: Cut
quality.description: The third ‘C’ is cut, the other most important factor for the quality of ruby gemstone. Thepurpose for gemstone cut is to enhance their beauty. The typical and most popular shaped with cutters for ruby are round and oval. The shapes in the rubies can emphasise the red color. The faceting in the oval and round shape rubies have the best reflection and spark.

quality.name: Carat
quality.description: Carat refers to weight of gemstones. Carat is the way gemstone weight is measured. Carat is one of the 4C’s in how quality is assessed because it is the most important for the reason many people think ‘bigger is better’. Like most other gems, rubies are also weighed in carat. good quality rubies are available in a wide range of size. The larger a ruby the more expensive it is.

gemstone.name: Sapphire
gemstone.description: Sapphires are the most popular and desirable gemstone. They are one of the preciousgemstones. It is a variety of the mineral corundum consisting of aluminium oxide with traceamount if other elements. It is the corundum family. sapphires are known for their blue colorbut they do appear in number of other varieties of color. They have known as a valuablegemstone. Sapphires has a wealth of historical meaning. The word sapphire comes form theGreek work “sappheiros” meaning blue stone. They are associated with loyalty. It is believedthat sapphires bring lack, loyalty and happiness and love. The first sapphire discovered, dates back to the 7th century BC. Traditionally, sapphire symbolizes nobility, truth, sincerity, andfaithfulness. In ancient Greece and Rome, kings and queens were convinced that blue sapphires protected their owners from envy and harm. Sapphires are known as September birth stone.

type.name: Treated rubies
type.description: Gemstone have been treated to improve their appearance for a very long time. Treatment is   used to improve the clarity and color of a gemstone. Treated emeralds are natural emeralds   pass through treatment. emeralds have been treated for many years to overcome the inherent   softness of the emeralds and give them an improvement in their appearance. The mostcommon emerald treatment are oiling and fracture filling.

type.name: Untreated emeralds
type.description: Untreated emeralds are natural emeralds as mined from the earth. They are the kind ofemeralds that has not been treated at all which means no oiling or fracture filling. Less than 2%of emeralds make it to market completely untreated. There fore, they are the rarest and themost valuable emeralds.

type.name: Synthetic emeralds
type.description: Synthetic emeralds are growing in laboratories, man made rubies. They are identical with thenatural rubies with their chemical and crystal compositions. They only differ with place oforigin. And they are different to synthesize. They are less expensive than the real naturalemeralds

type.name: Hardness
type.description: Hardness for gemstones is the ability to resist scratching. It is about the bonds between the atoms in the stone. Emeralds are very resistant to scratches. They are relatively hard 7.5 to 8 on Mohs scale of hardness from the scale of 1 to 10, 10 being the hardest. Mohs scale is the direct measurement of hardness of gems.

type.name: Durability
type.description: Emeralds are very durable gems. They have a great hardness which means it is pretty durable can be worn everyday. They have great toughness and no cleavage. Their hardness indicates their high durability.

quality.name: Color
quality.description: Color is the most meaningful ‘C’. even though, sapphires come in a wide variety of range of color, they are mor known as a blue gemstone. The other colors rather than the color blue are considered fancy. The color sapphire depends on the priority of chromogenic elements in the chemical composition. The most common sapphire colors are:Blue sapphire- it is the most valued, most famous sapphire color. The best color of bluesapphire is an intense deep royal blue. It is the rarest and most valuable type of sapphire. Theless valuable are garish, too light or too dark blue. It is believed that blue sapphires provide aprotection and they act like a shield.Yellow sapphire- they are available in a variety of color saturation. They represent living grace and power. It is believed that yellow sapphires provide mental peace, courage and happiness and they reduce the tendence of getting angry. They are not that expensive.pink sapphire- the color of the pink sapphire ranges from light red to light purple. Some cultures believes that they hold power. They symbolize trust and loyalty. They are common  types of sapphires.  Green sapphire- they are uncommon, less desirable sapphires. They symbolizes tranquility  and calmness.

quality.name: Clarity
quality.description: Clarity in gemstone refers to what the stone should not have. The highest clarity means free of inclusion. However, emeralds contain inclusion that is easily visible. They are major gemstone  expected to have visible inclusion. They are known for being included. The higher the clarity the more valuable the emerald is. Eye clean are more valuable and the inclusion should not have a negative impact on the transparency to be considered valuable.

quality.name: Cut
quality.description: The third ‘C’ is cut, the other most important factor for the quality of emerald gemstone. Thepurpose for gemstone cut is to enhance their beauty. Cut in emeralds refers to its shape,faceting and depth. When making the cut, the color and inclusion must be considered. Thecutter must minimize the affect of the fractures. It should be symmetrical with the facets. Theround and oval cuts are most expensive type of emeralds

quality.name: Carat
quality.description: Carat refers to weight of gemstones. Carat is the way gemstone weight is measured. Carat is one of the 4C’s in how quality is assessed because it is the most important for the reason manypeople think ‘bigger is better’. Like most other gems, emeralds are also weighed in carat.Emeralds come in a wide range of size. The price increases as the size increases.

gemstone.name: Diamond
gemstone.description: Diamonds are the most popular gemstones in the world. It is a gemstone composed of pure carbon. They are formed under high temperature beneath the earth. They are the hardest most durable, most desired, valuable, popular gemstone. The earliest diamonds found in India in 4th century B.C. they have been treasured since ancient times. The color of diamonds varies from colorless to black. The most valuable desired diamonds are colorless. Diamonds are the most precious of all gemstones and unique in many ways. They are popular for its sparkling fire,  hardness, durability and highest value. They represent love and have been used as an  engagement ring starting 1477. Diamonds represent strength, love and health. They have been  linked to romance for ages. They are most associated with an engagement ring. The word  diamond drives from the Greeks word ‘adamas’ which means multiple. They are considered as  the stone of champions throughout the history. Diamonds are known as April birthstone

type.name: Treated Diamonds
type.description: Gemstone have been treated to improve their appearance for a very long time. Treatment is used to improve the clarity and color of a gemstone. Treated diamonds are natural diamonds pass through treatment. Treated diamonds are improved in quality, modified with inclusions or enhanced with color diamonds. The three most common diamond treatment are laser drilling, fracture filling and high pressure (HPHT). Laser drilling- lasers are used to remove the inclusions in the diamonds. In laser drilling the inclusions become less visible. They are used to make included diamonds more marketable. Fracture filling- the other most common treatment method that is used for diamonds is fracture filling. it is filling glass like substance which has similar property with the diamon . It used to improve the visibility and clarity of the diamond and it can last for years. High temperature (HPHT)- high temperature is exposing it to high pressure. It is used to eliminate the brown color.

type.name: Untreated diamonds
type.description: Untreated Diamonds are natural diamonds as mined from the earth. They are the kind of diamonds that has not been treated or enhanced at all. They are the rarest and the mostvaluable diamonds.

type.name: Synthetic diamonds
type.description: Synthetic diamonds are growing in laboratories rubies. They are identical with the natural   rubies with their chemical and crystal compositions. They only differ with place of origin. They   are less expensive than the real natural diamonds and take only months to form rather million       years.

type.name: Hardness
type.description: Hardness for gemstones is the ability to resist scratching. It is about the bonds between the atoms in the stone. Diamonds are relatively hard 10 on Mohs scale of hardness from the scale of 1 to 10, 10 being the hardest. Mohs scale is the measurement of gems hardness and it is the hardest gem of all. You can’t scratch diamond with metal.

type.name: Durability
type.description: In case of durability, diamonds are the most durable gemstone. They have great toughness and no cleavage. Their hardness indicates their high durability. They are incredibly durable with highest hardness and thermal conductivity.

quality.name: Color
quality.description: The color difference in the diamonds affect the value of the diamonds. Diamonds come in manycolors. Their value differs with the range of the different they came in. the colorless diamonds are the rarest and most valuable gemstone. A chemically pure perfect diamond has no hue.A color of a diamond graded in alphabetical scale for D to Y, in which is D is totally colorless andY indicates an intense deep yellow color. This ranging describes the amount of yellowsaturation.

quality.name: Clarity
quality.description: Clarity in gemstone refers to what the stone should not have. The highest clarity means free of    inclusion. The clarity of diamonds is graded on the size and visibility of inclusion. Clarity is the    absence of inclusions. Clarity appearances might have negative influence on the quality of the    diamond. Flawless diamonds are the most valuable and rare type. 11, clarity graded are there in    diamonds clarity graded system. Which are: flawless, internal flawless, WS1, WS2, VS1, VS2, SI1,    SI2, I1, I2 and I3.

quality.name: Cut
quality.description: Cut is the other most important factor for the quality of diamonds. The purpose for gemstonecut is to enhance their beauty. A great cut diamond is a diamond with every facet displaying.The point is to make light perform better in the stone. Diamonds are known for their ability totransmit light and sparkle. The cut in a diamond is crucial to its beauty and value. The higher the cut grade, the brighter and more valuable the diamond is. The most known cuts for diamonds are oval, round, marquise, pearl and heart shape. The other shapes are called fancy cuts.

quality.name: Carat
quality.description: Carat refers to weight of gemstones. Carat is the way gemstone weight is measured. Carat is one of the 4C’s in how quality is assessed because it is the most important for the reason many people think ‘bigger is better’. diamonds are also weighed in carat. good quality diamonds are available in a wide range of size. Price increases with diamond carat, larger are more desirable,valuable and rare.

history.description: India has also been a pioneer in the history of gems. Indians were known for being the firs people to mine and use diamonds. They were the first people to mention diamond for the world. Indian also was the world’s sole supplier of gemstone for ages. For more than 5000 years, jewellery played a big role in Indian history.India was the world’s sole supplier of gemstones for over 2000 years. Most spectacular diamonds originated from Indian mines. To this day in India, gems and jewellery carry potent messages of power, honor and love. Indians have believed in healing and protective power of gemstones for ages. Gemstones are a ray of hope and are considered to certain energy that helps in removing obstacles and problems. The most popular gemstones in ancient Indian history are:
history.name: India
history.title: Gem In Ancient India

type.name: Rubies
type.description: rubies are one of the most popular gemstones in ancient India history. Most ancient Indian jewellery features the well-rewarded water worn rubies. In ancient India, rubies were called the “retnarar” or “king of precious stones”. Rubies are more valued than any other gems in ancient India. It is believed that it can increase wealth, impress rivals and protect from harm.

type.name: Sapphires
type.description: in ancient India, sapphire was linked to the planet of Saturn. Indians believed sapphires were stones of wisdom and serenity. They are used release mental tension and  depression. The star of India blue sapphire is one of the worlds most famous gemstone with its  incredible size and blue color

type.name: Pearls
type.description: the ancient Indian kept the best for themselves and traded pearls form all corner of the earth. In India pearls are associated with the moon and symbolize purity and love. They believed that the supreme god kirishina descended in to the ocean where he discovered the first pearl and give it to his daughter. They used it as jewelry, to adorn clothing and crush it to use it as a cosmetics and medicine

history.description: Other than the Egyptian, ancient Greeks was also known in gems. Jewelry was popular in ancient Greece and they started using gems in jewelry in earlier times. Ancient Greece the birth  place of the western civilization is popular in the gemstone ancient history. Gems were  imported to Greece from all over the world. The Greece began importing precious stones and used them to make colored jewelleries in the 300B.C. Gems in the ancient Greece was worn as a decoration, jewellery and also as a symbol of power. Beside the jewelry making, ancient Greeks believe gemstones cocoon the powers of Gods and Goddesses. They also believed in after life so that the usually used to bury the dead with their   tressure. Both man and women wore jewelry in ancient Greece. The popular gemstones in           ancient Greece history are:
history.title: Gem In Ancient Greece
history.name: Greece

type.name: Amethyst
type.description: the most popular gemstone in the ancient Greece history is the amethysts. Thename amethyst comes from the Greek word “amethystos” which means not drunken. The Greeks wore amethysts and carved drinking vessels from the gemstone by believing it would prevent intoxication. Its great character is the array colors found in the stone. The color purples have often been associated with royalty.

type.name: Diamond
type.description: Diamonds, the most popular and expensive gemstones in the world is also most              popular in ancient Greece gemstone history. In fact, the word diamond drives from the Greek word “Adamas” meaning indestructible. Diamonds are popular in Greek methodology. Greeks believed diamonds were tears of gods and splinters that had broken off of falling stars.

type.name: Emerald
type.description: as the other gemstones, the emerald word also drives from the Greek word “smaragdus” meaning green. The great Greek philosopher, Aristotle, was convinced that having an emerald give the owner a success. They are also known to powdered emeralds to use as eye lotion and they believed that the gemstone had the ability to give the wearer victory in trials and comforts eye sight.

type.name: Sapphire
type.description: the word sapphire also comes form the Greek word “sappheiros” meaning blue stone. The Greeks believed sky was reflection of sapphire due to blue appearance of the sky. It is believed that they contain the power of protection and healing. The Greeks associate  sapphire with the god apollo. They were also often worn as adornment to connect those to sprit world. The gemstone was popular with the witches in the ancient Greece due to their abilities to tap the ‘third eye’.

history.description: The ancient Chinese community uses gemstone for prestige purposes, healing, power, energy,    luck and as a symbol of wealth. According to the Chinese the higher price value of the stone,the better would be the luck of its wearer.For some Chinese communities, possession of gemstones adorned with cultural properties is deemed prestigious as well. The use of gemstones for healing and medical purposes is an aspect which should be well and deeply documented. The current generation depend highly on modern medicines. However, it is to be noted that older generations lived longer and healthier lives thus urging the current generation to deeply analyse the benefits of local intelligence. It can be assumed that religion is the main factor influencing the use of gemstones among ancient Chinese. The popular gemstones in ancient Chinese history are:
history.title: Gem In Ancient China
history.name: China

type.name: Diamond
type.description: : Diamonds, the most popular and expensive gemstones in the world is also most popular in ancient China gemstone history. The ancient Chinese used diamonds to polish ceremonial stones long before 6000 BC. Chinese woman symbolizes diamonds as a symbolizefor financial independence. Diamonds in ancient China are known for their healing andprotective properties.

type.name: Jade
type.description: jade is the most desired gem in China throughout history. It was regarded the most precious stone in ancient China and symbolized purity and moral integrity. Jade treasured in China from the ancient time to present day. The colour varies from blue to lavender, white, yellow, black, orange and pink. It has been mined in China, since 6000 BC. The Chinese used jade for jewellery, weapons, carving and ritual objects. It was believed the stone conferred immortality

type.name: Nephrite
type.description: it is the other most popular gemstone found in China. Nephrite appears in a variety of tones. The ancient Chinese used it for beads and carving. They believed nephrite can heal migraine, eye disease and evil thoughts. They used it as fashion tool. In ancient China, nephrite names are based on color. White nephrite has always been and still is the most highly revered. Next on the popularity list is green nephrite. It has the hue of the most valuable gem . The slightly weaker luster gives it a more conservative look. Green nephrite has attracted consumer attention due to the recently skyrocketing prices of white nephrite and good-quality jadeite jade.

history.description: The ancient Egyptian used carnelian, emerald, lazuli and clear quartz in their jewellery. They used gemstone gemstones for beauty, protection, health, wealth and power. Most gemstone are so popular in Ancient Egypt. The famous queen cleopatra was known by wearing different gemstones. In ancient Egypt, it is believed that gems have a positive impact on the people rather than beauty. It was believed that gems can cure eye diseases, any health problems, bring the wearer a good luck and provide protection. Gemstone jewelleries were worn as personal adornment, social status, economical status, medicine, and protection in the ancient Egypt gemstone history. Some of the most popular gemstone in ancient Egypt history are:
history.name: Egypt
history.title: Gem In Ancient Egypt

type.name: Gold
type.description: gold was a most popular gemstone in the ancient Egyptian. It used to be believed to bethe flesh of the gods. Gold in ancient Egypt used to signify godliness, wealth and purity.Egyptian used to believe it is heavenly metal and considered it as the skin of gods andgoddesses.

type.name: Lapis Lazuli:
type.description: lapis lazuli is the most treasured gemstone. Egyptian associate blue color with loyalty, so they love this gemstone. Since it reflectsthe color of the sky, Egyptian associate it with holiness, creation and resurrection. They used it to create blue cosmetics. Cleopatra used to use powdered lapis lazuli as eye adornment. Lapis lazuli was associated with strength, courage, loyalty, wisdom, intellect and truth in the ancient Egyptian. It was also believed to protect the wearer from evil. It is used as a beauty cosmetic and to improve eye sight.

type.name: Turquois
type.description: turquois is the most ancient gemstone. It is the other most treasured gemstone in  ancient Egypt. Evidences shows that turquois come from the ancient Egyptian tombs back in  3000B.C. It represents happiness and cleanness. It was believed as a holy stone which brings  good luck. It was mostly used to adore necks of the pharaohs. Egyptian used the turquois for necklaces and rings by fashioning it with small objects

type.name: Emerald
type.description: emeralds first discovered in Egypt back to 330 B.C. emerald was so popular in    ancient Egyptian gemstone history. It is one of the traditionally considered precious gemstone    along diamond, ruby and sapphire. The famous queen cleopatra was one of the four queens   that adore emerald and famous for wearing it. It was believed that emeralds are symbol foreternal life and for that reason pharaohs used to be buried with them. It was used to believe that the green color in the stone represent fertility and rebirth.

type.name: Topaz
type.description: topaz is the other most common and known gemstone in ancient Egypt history. TheEgyptian associate the gemstone with the sun god, Ra. They believed that it is extremelypowerful stone. They say that the sun god, Ra created topaz’s beautiful yellow color. And itknown for its healing power. They also used to believe that it protects the wearers from evil and nightmares

history.name: Ethiopia
history.title: History of gems in Ethiopia

type.name: opal:
type.description: : Opal was the first Ethiopian gemstone that rose to fame, emerging from the northernprovince of Wollo in large volume and various qualities. Opal in Ethiopia was discovered in 1994 and has grown to become second in the world gemstone market. The different types of opalslike precious fire opal, black opal, fire opals are being mined under the name welo/wollo/wello  or Ethiopian opal. The north part of the country has a wonderful kind of colors.    The opal deposit occurs in the area around the cities of dessie and Lalibela. Ethiopian opal has    been considered a volcanic opal. Color of Ethiopian opal includes white, black, colorless, brown,    chocolate brown

type.name: Emeralds
type.description: : The Ethiopian emerald first discovered around 2010. It is on the verge of growing.Emerald in Ethiopia was found in the area called ‘shakiso’ which is southern part of Ethiopia.Most of the mined emeralds are lighter green hue in color. The Ethiopian emeralds are natural and doesn’t have many inclusions.The Ethiopian emeralds have a wide range of quality and sizes. The quality of the gemstones isgaining its reputation world wide.

type.name: Sapphires
type.description: sapphire reached the market originated from the northern Ethiopia part.  Sapphires are mined and traded in the vicinity of Axum. The sapphires are located in the near town of Chilla, northwest of Axum. The sapphire found in Ethiopia are mainly blue sapphire with a few pure dark yellow

history.description: Gemstones are the result of crystallization under high pressure. The age of gemstones staring from the time they were formed in the earth, ranges between million to billion years. People have been using and attracted to gems since the ancient time. People have treasure gems for many reasons throughout ages. For the beautiful decorating ornaments, medicinal purposes,religion and good-luck charms are among those reasons. Gemstones have been called with a different names like healing stones, mood stones, healing crystals, chakra stones and other throughout history. Ethiopia has an incredibly rich history spanning several millennia, but gemstones were not a part of this history until a decade ago.Gemstones never played a significant role in the ancient Ethiopian history. The last two decadesare the emerge of gemstones in Ethiopia. The recent years brings the exciting news in the gemstone area for the Ethiopians. Precious and semi-precious gemstone have been reported to be found in the country.Ethiopia is landlocked eastern African country with fertile grassland, great lakes and massive canyons. Ethiopia is known as a land of origin. It is a land of plenty of resources. Concerning gemstones opals lead the pack. Currently Ethiopian opal is the second high quality opal, next to Australia in the world. Some of the most popular gemstone in currently in Ethiopia are

type.name: Natural
type.description: Natural gemstones are found in nature, created deep in the Earth and mined out of it. They are mined natural gemstones formed by nature without human involvement. If a gemstone is natural, it means it is mined and nature gifted gemstone. They are sometimes enhanced, which means they were treated in some way to improve their color or clarity. Natural gems tend to have more inclusions than synthetic ones. Natural gems have the allure of rarity whencompared to the synthetic gemstones. for this reason, they are more valuable and expensive.

type.name: Synthetic
type.description: Synthetic, Lab-created or man made are formed in laboratories by using advanced techniques by human hand and machine to recreate the natural gemstones. They are chemical, physical, and optically identical to gems found in nature. Synthetic gemstone has less inclusion compared to the natural gemstones and often described as “too perfect” in their appearance.They are also more brilliant in color. They are less expensive than the natural gemstone for they don’t have the rarity of the natural gems. Some synthetic gemstones are more difficult to differentiate in the naked eye from the natural gemstone that even gemologists need microscopes to detect them.

type.name: Precious
type.description: Gems are classified as precious and semi-precious depend on rarity and importance of the gemstones. Precious gemstones have more beauty, durability and rarity than the semi-precious  gemstones. Semi-precious gemstones have only one or two of these qualities. The hardness,quality, rarity and beauty of their color create the difference in the precious and semi-precious gemstones. Diamonds, emeralds, rubies, and sapphires are all considered to be precious, andthereby, the most valuable and most desirable.

type.name: Semi-precious
type.description: Semi precious doesn’t mean they are less beautiful. Semi precious gemstone by them selves  have their own beauty. Every other gemstone that isn’t one of the four (Diamonds, rubies,  emeralds ad sapphires) is called semi-precious gemstones.

type.name: Untreated
type.description: Untreated gemstones are natural gemstones that are not altered or enhanced in any way. They are gemstones as mined from the earth. They remain in the same form of as they extracted from the earth. They only get cutted and polished to be used as jewellery. They are very rareand expensive in the market.

type.name: Treated
type.description: Treated gemstones are gemstones that have been treated in different ways to improve theirappearance. Treatments are used to improve the clarity and colour of the gemstone. Morethan 90% of the gemstones in the market are treated. They are less expensive, less durable andmore available than the untreated gemstones. Different gemstones get treated in differenttypes of treatments, such as, heating, oiling, bleaching, fracture filling and so on
